COMMITTEE ON SCIENTIFIC AIDS TO LEARNING
COMMITTEE OF NATIONAL RESEARCH COUNCIL
41 EAST 42ND STREET, NEW YORK, N.Y.
Telephone: Murray Hill 2-8352
James B. Conant, Chairman
Vannevar Bush
Ross G. Harrison
Frank B. Jewett
Bethuel M. Webster
Ben D. Wood
January 16, 1940
Irvin Stewart, Director
Mr, Frank E. Schooley
Radio Station WILL
University of Illinois
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Mr. Schooley:
I suspect that Mr. Ebel*s comment about
the general attitude of teachers toward electronic devices
is only too well justified, and I must admit I do not know
what can be done about it. Perhaps something eventually
will be done at teacher training institutions, but that
will have to await an awakening by those institutions to
the possibilities of auditory and visual aids. Meantime,
we can only hope that while a large part of the seed will
be thrown upon barren ground enough of it will land in
fertile soil to justify the sowers* efforts.
Sincerely yours.
Irvin Stewart,
Director
IS/gq
